plugins.name: Frame Inspector
plugins.description:
Frame Inspector is a powerful Figma plugin designed to enhance your workflow by simplifying frame management. With Frame Inspector, you can effortlessly select multiple frames and instantly interpret their widths, while automatically adding device labels and pixel measurements to their names. Say goodbye to manual labeling and tedious calculations!


Simply select the desired frames, and Frame Inspector will analyze their widths and append the appropriate labels to their names, indicating whether they represent a mobile device, tablet, or desktop view.


Additionally, the plugin displays the precise width measurement in pixels, making it easier than ever to identify and organize frames according to their intended display context.

plugins.name: 8pt Grid Align
plugins.description:
8pt Grid Align eliminates the tedious task of aligning designs to an 8-point grid. A simple, no-fuss solution to amplify your design workflow.

  1. Instantly snap objects and round object measurements to the 8pt grid with one click.
  2. Scale proportionally, while keeping stroke weights intact.
  3. Quickly apply preset container sizes and grid widths for common screen sizes.
  4. Use the lock ratio option for precise resizing and scaling.


If aligning to 8-point grid divisions feels like a chore, this plugin will save you time and make your layouts cleaner and more consistent.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly align and scale your designs to the 8-point grid with precision and ease.

plugins.name: Mock Data Generator
plugins.description:
Mock Data Generator is a Figma plugin designed to enhance the design process within Figma by allowing designers to insert realistic mock text data directly into their designs. 


This plugin provides a wide range of data categories and types that can enable you to visualize how your design elements will appear when populated with actual data. 


By using this plugin, you can create more accurate, context-relevant prototypes, to improve the overall user experience and the efficiency of your design iterations.


How to Use the Plugin


  1. Open the Plugin: Start by selecting the text layer in your Figma design that you want to replace with mock data. Then, open the Mock Data Generator plugin from the Figma plugin menu.


  1. Select Category and Data Type: Use the dropdown menus to choose the category of data (e.g., Personal Identification, Professional Information) and then select the specific type of data you need (e.g., First Name, Email Address).


  1. Insert Data: Click the "Replace Selected Text" button to insert the selected mock data into the chosen text layer. If successful, the plugin will notify you that the text has been replaced. If not, it will provide a message prompting you to make the necessary selections.


  1. Review and Iterate: Review the design with the inserted data to ensure it meets your needs. Adjust categories and data types as necessary to simulate different user scenarios and refine your design.
plugins.tagline: Generate high-quality mock text data for your Figma designs.

plugins.name: pixelbrush
plugins.description:
Pixelbrush allows you to quickly draw, pixel by pixel. Because every pixel drawn is a square, these drawings can easily be resized, copied, and manipulated with Figma's default selection tools.


Basic undo is supported. This plugin provides an earthy palette of 6 colors by default, but users can now use their own custom palette's by creating and selecting a set of squares with colors of their choice and then pressing the "select button" in the pixelbrush interface!


Tips:

  1. If you are having trouble finding the square or the plugin behavior is unresponsive try pressing "reset"
  2. If this fails, try exiting out of the plugin and restarting it with option + command + p.
  3. rasterize large pixel art to make copying it more performant.
  4. Option + drag is a great way to create patterns.
plugins.tagline: Create and manipulate pixel art

plugins.name: Onyx â—† Design System to Code
plugins.description:
Onyx â—† Design System to Code


â—† Overview


Onyx is designed to simplify the workflow between design and development by automating the conversion of your Figma Design System into ready-to-use Vue components. Its ability to handle multiple selected component variants and integrate design tokens provided via the Tokens Studio for Figma plugin makes it a powerful tool for modern web development.


Onyx is a Figma plugin designed to efficiently translate Figma Design Systems into Vue components, utilizing UnoCSS utility classes. This tool targets developers and designers looking to streamline the conversion of their design systems into functional, reactive UI components directly usable in Vue projects.


Project is open source:

https://github.com/onyx-gen/onyx



â—† What It Does


  • Figma Components to Vue Components: Onyx allows users to select components within Figma and generate corresponding Vue components. Design properties are translated to UnoCSS utility classes.


  • Support for Design Tokens: The plugin integrates with Tokens Studio, another Figma plugin, to convert design tokens into CSS variables. These variables are then passed to the UnoCSS utility classes (e.g., background color design token named primary.bg.hover generates the bg-$primary.bg.hover UnoCSS utility class)


  • Multi-Variant Component Support: Users can select multiple variants of a component (such as default, hover, and focused) and Onyx will generate a single Vue component. Onyx automatically applies the correct UnoCSS variants (e.g., bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 focus:bg-red-800)


  • Live Preview: Onyx provides a real-time preview of the generated Vue components within Figma via an iframe. This feature ensures that components are visually and functionally in sync with the Figma design.



â—† How to Use It


  1. Select Components: Start by selecting one or multiple components within your Figma design system.
  2. Open the Onyx Figma plugin: Open the Onyx Figma plugin in Figma's plugin panel.
  3. Generate Code: Onyx automatically generates Vue components for the selected Figma components.
  4. Implement in Project: Copy the generated Vue component into your Vue project.



â—† Limitations


  • Work in Progress: As the plugin is still under development, some design properties may not convert perfectly into UnoCSS utility classes. At the moment not all design tokens types can be applied.


  • Design Compatibility: There may be limitations in how certain Figma design properties translate to UnoCSS utility classes, potentially requiring manual adjustments.
plugins.tagline: Components & Design Tokens â†’ Vue & UnoCSS

plugins.name: Responsive variables
plugins.description:
The plugin is designed to streamline the management of typography and sizing variables in responsive design projects. With this plugin, you can efficiently create and manage typography and sizing variables using standardized naming conventions and automate the creation of styles with linked variables.


Demo file https://www.figma.com/community/file/1419690653122064051/responsive-variables-demo


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Variable Creation: Generates typography or sizing variables based on a predefined naming convention.
  2. Linked Styles: Automatically creates text styles with linked variables, ensuring consistency and ease of updates.
  3. Parameter Multipliers: Manages parameters like line-height and letter-spacing using multipliers, allowing the plugin to calculate pixel dimensions.
  4. Style Guide Generation: Automatically create a style guide that's synced with all typography and spacing styles, giving you a quick overview of the design elements. This functionality will generate a new page called "Responsive variables".
  5. Used styles report (beta): This functionality allows users to generate a detailed report listing all the occurrences of different sizes used within a document, providing a comprehensive overview for analysis or optimization purposes


How it works:


  1. When the plugin starts, automatically load all local variables.
  2. The plugin automatically creates a new "Variables" collection where all the variables are stored.
  3. Every time you create a new variable, a text style is automatically created, and all the individual variables are bound to the corresponding property.
  4. Upon plugin load, the plugin generates a fileRefId variable containing a hash. This hash is used as a reference to store ordering data in the pluginâ€™s local storage, ensuring data is kept separate for each file. If you encounter any issues, click the menu icon in the top-right corner of the plugin window and select â€œReset Storage Data.â€
plugins.tagline: Advanced Management of Typography Variables and Sizing for Responsive Design.

plugins.name: Filla - Color Palette Extractor
plugins.description:
What it does

Filla dives through every nested layer; shapes, text, vectors, icons, and pulls out every unique solid and gradient fill or stroke. It then drops those colours into a neat swatch grid on-canvas, each labelled with its HEX value. One click turns the whole set into named Figma Color Styles.


How to use:

1. Select any parent frame, component, or section.

2. Run Filla â†’ watch the deep scan.

3. Review the generated palette.

4. Hit Create Styles to add them to your library.


Why itâ€™s handy

â€¢ Kick-start a design system by surfacing legacy colours.

â€¢ Audit messy files and spot duplicates fast.

â€¢ Hand off a clear colour spec to developers in seconds.
plugins.tagline: Extract every colour in any selection, auto-build a palette, and convert to Color Styles.

plugins.name: Figaro Design System Token
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin for Exporting Variables


This Figma plugin simplifies the export of design variables (such as colors, typography, and dimensions) into a structured JSON format. It's ideal for design and development teams aiming to maintain consistency between their Figma design system and codebase.


With this plugin, you can export local variables organized into collections, including details about modes, aliases, and default values, making it easy to integrate them into development workflows like creating design tokens or style systems in CSS or JavaScript.


Features:


Export color, typography, spacing, and more from Figma to JSON.

Support for variable collections and modes (e.g., dark/light mode).

Alias management for consistent use of styles across projects.

Easy integration with development tools to use exported variables in web or mobile projects.

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.
plugins.tagline: Export Collection Variables

Introduction

The "Dark Mode Assistant for Components" plugin is designed to streamline the process of managing dark mode properties in Figma components. With just a few clicks, you can quickly enable dark mode for any selected component or instance, while also applying the appropriate token settings for dark mode if available.


Function Description

  1. Automatically detects and enables dark mode for selected components and instances.
  2. Recursively checks and updates dark mode for all nested components within groups and frames.
  3. Allows you to apply the "dark" token from your component library's appearance module.
  4. Works seamlessly with components that have "componentProperties" and "appearance" modules.


How to Use

  1. Select the components, groups, or frames that you want to apply dark mode to.
  2. Click the plugin button to enable dark mode for all selected elements and their children.
  3. The plugin will automatically apply the dark mode setting and, if available, link it to the "dark" token in your component library.


Precautions

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

plugins.name: Sunsetter
plugins.description:
Sunsetter is useful for deprecating components before publishing the next version of your design system.


  1. Supports bulk deprecation component sets and components, whether it is made of frames or auto layouts.
  2. Also supports adding your own prefix for the deprecation. If left blank, it uses the default.
  3. Deprecations can also be reversed in bulk. If a custom prefix is used, simply use the prefix and reverse.
  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs

plugins.name: cmd-c - Generate HTML and Tailwind code
plugins.description:
cmd-c generates HTML and Tailwind code similar to your handwritten code.


It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.
plugins.tagline: AI that generates handwritten tailwind code from your Figma designs.

cmd-c generates HTML and Tailwind code similar to your handwritten code.


It converts both Auto Layout and Absolute Positioned (Vector-Based) UI into Flex Positioned code.


cmd-c also generates semantically correct HTML by identifying the content (e.g., p, span, img, video) and interactive elements (e.g., button, a).


Our goal at cmd-c is to create the best developer handoff tool, allowing developers to focus on building what truly matters.
95404.release_notes: - Removed login and made the plugin more accessible.
95404.tagline: AI that generates handwritten tailwind code from your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Image Text Extractor (AI)
plugins.description:
Simply select any image layer or frame, click "Extract Text," and watch as the plugin captures all visible text while preserving line breaks and formatting.


Add extracted text directly to your Figma designs with a single click - either as a single element or separated by line breaks.


Unlike other OCR solutions, our plugin works entirely within Figma, eliminating the need to switch between apps or use external services.


Powered by Google's Gemini 1.5 Flash model, it delivers superior accuracy with support for multiple languages and complex layouts.


Perfect for designers working with client mockups, UI screenshots, or any design asset containing text that needs to be extracted and edited.

plugins.name: PSD Importer for Figma
plugins.description:
Import your PSD files directly into Figma. It preserves the design elements such as layer structure, text properties, and complex styles, offering a smooth transition from Photoshop to Figma.


There are 2 import methods.

  1. Import all layers with maximum compatibility.
  2. Import each layer is bitmap image.


While the plugin strives for high accuracy, some discrepancies may occur due to differences between Photoshop and Figmaâ€™s rendering engines - particularly with complex effects, blending modes, and certain layer styles. In cases where features canâ€™t be translated, some layers may be imported as images.


Users can try the plugin with three free PSD imports, after which unlimited access is available through an $8/month subscription.

plugins.name: Cloudinary
plugins.description:
Enhance team collaboration, streamline your workflows, and leverage Cloudinaryâ€™s powerful media management features for your Figma assets.

The Cloudinary plugin integrates directly within Figma, allowing users to effortlessly insert images from the Cloudinary Media Library and upload images to Figma to share with others.


To get started:

  1. Sign up for a free Cloudinary account.
  2. Install the Cloudinary plugin from this marketplace page.
  3. In Figma, select Cloudinary from the Plugin menu to open the interface and log in.
  4. Choose a layer or artboard, then:
  5. Use the Library tab to insert images from Cloudinary into Figma.
  6. Use the Upload tab to upload images from Figma to Cloudinary.
plugins.tagline: Use Cloudinary images and videos in Figma

plugins.name: Keywords Generator
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on â€Generate Keywordsâ€ and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. Iâ€™d love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

plugins.name: Markly - Paste/Copy from Markdown
plugins.description:
Markly makes it effortless to bring Markdown into your Figma designs or export Figma text layers as Markdown. Paste or type Markdown to instantly create styled text layers, copy selected layers as clean Markdown, and map Markdown elements to your local text styles for brand consistency.


The plugin has three command launcher:

  1. Convert from Markdown: Paste or select Markdown text and generate Figma layers.
  2. Copy as Markdown: Export Figma text layers as ready-to-use Markdown.
  3. Match Styles: Map headings, lists, and links to your custom Figma text styles.


Includes live preview, dark/light theme support, and an intuitive manual copy UI for full clipboard compatibility.
plugins.tagline: Paste, copy, and map Markdown content to Figma text layers with style.
